page.title: 04Kentmere valley industry
page.content: The Waterford Bridge works of British Industrial Sand seems strangely out of place in a rural area such as this. The factory was originally established by Cape Insulation Ltd. to process the diatomaceous earth dredged from the bed of the former glacial lake 400m. to the north and carried to the factory by overhead cable-way. When the material was dried, the vegetable matter burnt off in a long, slowly revolving cylindrical furnace, and the resultant powder mixed with several minerals including asbestos, there is produced a material with a very high insulation factor, ideal for use in power stations for example. However, in the 1970's, asbestos went out of use, the 'earth' could be imported more cheaply than it could be won from the local lake, and production ceased.
